label: Alaska
notes: In Alaska, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: Arkansas
notes: In Arkansas, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: California
notes: In California, those convicted of felonies can register and vote after serving their sentence. Also, 16 and 17 year olds can also preregister to vote at the above link for future elections!

label: Colorado
notes: In Colorado, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence.

label: Connecticut
notes: For some reason, Connecticut's voter registration website is down every night from midnight until 6AM. So... just know that... also, in Connecticut, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence and parole.

label: Delaware
notes: The deadline for uniformed service members and Delaware citizens living out of the country is 9 days after the deadline for everyone else!

label: District of Columbia
notes: In DC, you can pre-register to vote when you're 16 years old! (You can't vote in the 2020 election, but you'll be registered for 2022 and any upcoming elections!) DC is also one of three states that lets citizens vote from prison (and/or after serving their sentence)!

label: Georgia
notes: In Georgia, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: Hawaii
notes: In Hawaii, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence.

label: Idaho
notes: In Idaho, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: Illinois
notes: In Illinois, those with felony convictions get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: Indiana
notes: In Indiana, those with felony convictions get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: Kansas
notes: In Kansas, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: Louisiana
notes: Those convicted of felonies can vote again in Louisiana after serving their sentence and parole.

label: Maine
notes: Maine is one of three states that lets citizens vote from prison (and/or after serving their sentence)!

label: Maryland
notes: In Maryland, those with felony convictions get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: Massachusetts
notes: In Massachusetts, those with felony convictions get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: Michigan
notes: In Michigan, those with felony convictions get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: Minnesota
notes: In Minnesota, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: Missouri
notes: In Missouri, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation. Those who were overseas or deployed may also be able to register after the deadline!

label: Montana
notes: If you miss the official deadline, Montana also offers late registration up until the date before the election! Check out where you can register in the state's link above. Those with felony convictions also get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence.

label: Nebraska
notes: Listed above is thes online deadline, but you can register in person through the next week! Check the state's website above for more info. Also, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: Nevada
notes: Just a heads up, the mail-in registration deadline is a few weeks earlier than the online one! Also, in Nevada, those convicted of felonies get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence.

label: New Hampshire
notes: In New Hampshire, the deadline varies between 6 and 13 days before election day depending on the town you live in (13 days is shown here, but you could have more time)! Check the state's website above for specific info. Also, in NH, those people convicted of felonies have the right to vote after serving their sentence!

label: New Jersey
notes: There's a congressional election happening between the federal primary and general this year in NJ in September! The deadline for that one is Aug 28. In New Jersey, those with felony convictions get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: New Mexico
notes: The deadline for online registration is above, but if you missed it, the deadline for in person registration is the Saturday before the election! Those with felony convictions can register and vote in in NM after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: New York
notes: You can register to vote in person a few days after the mail in/online deadline! (Mail in is Oct 21st for the general) In New York, those with felony convictions get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: North Carolina
notes: If you missed the deadline, you can register and vote in person during early voting and on election day! Check the state website above. Also, in NC, those convicted of felonies get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: North Dakota
notes: In North Dakota, those with felony convictions get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: Ohio
notes: In Ohio, those with felony convictions get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: Oklahoma
notes: In Oklahoma, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: Oregon
notes: In Oregon, those with felony convictions get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: Pennsylvania
notes: In Pennsylvania, those with felony convictions get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: Rhode Island
notes: You can register to vote at the age of 16 in Rhode Island! While you can't vote in 2022 if you're under 18 by election day, you'll be set for the next election! Those convicted of felonies also get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: South Carolina
notes: In South Carolina, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: South Dakota
notes: In South Dakota, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: Tennessee
notes: In Tennessee, some people who were committed of felonies are eligible to vote! Check the state website above for details

label: Texas
notes: In Texas, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: Utah
notes: The deadline is at 5PM on the deadline day! Also, in Utah, those with felony convictions get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: Vermont
notes: In Vermont, you can easily register to vote up until Election Day! Vermont is also one of three states that lets citizens vote from prison (and/or after serving their sentence)!

label: Virginia
notes: In Virginia, those with felony convictions get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: Washington
notes: Even though you can register in person up until election day, the deadline to register online is 8 days before! Also, as of this year, those convicted of felonies in the state of Washington get their voting rights restored after serving their sentence!

label: West Virigina
notes: In West Virginia, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: Wisconsin
notes: In Wisconsin, those with felony convictions can register and vote after serving their sentence, parole, and probation.

label: Wyoming
notes: In Wyoming, unless you register in person, you have to get your registration form notarized. Sorry... you can register and vote absentee ballot on election day, though!
